title: WordPress Website Setup
description: Launch a professional WordPress website from scratch with hosting, theme, and essential plugins

steps.title: Choose a Web Hosting Provider
steps.description: Select reliable hosting for your WordPress site.
steps.instructions: Choose a hosting provider like Bluehost, SiteGround, or Hostinger. For beginners, shared hosting ($3-10/month) is sufficient. Look for one-click WordPress installation, SSL certificate, and good customer support.
tips: Bluehost and SiteGround are officially recommended by WordPress
Look for hosting with at least 99.9% uptime guarantee
Make sure SSL certificate is included (for https)
Check if they offer daily backups

steps.title: Purchase Hosting Plan and Domain
steps.description: Sign up for hosting and register your domain name.
steps.instructions: Select a hosting plan (Basic/Starter is fine for new sites). Choose your domain name - most hosts offer one free for the first year. Complete the purchase with your payment information. Save your login credentials securely.
tips: Choose .com if available for your domain
Keep domain name short, memorable, and easy to spell
Avoid hyphens and numbers in domain names
Consider privacy protection to hide your personal info in WHOIS

steps.title: Install WordPress
steps.description: Set up WordPress on your hosting account.
steps.instructions: Log into your hosting control panel (cPanel or custom dashboard). Look for 'WordPress' or 'Website' section. Click 'Install WordPress' or 'One-Click Install'. Choose your domain, create admin username and password. Click 'Install'.
tips: Don't use 'admin' as your username (security risk)
Use a strong, unique password
Save your login URL (usually yoursite.com/wp-admin)
Installation typically takes 1-2 minutes

steps.title: Log Into WordPress Dashboard
steps.instructions: Go to yoursite.com/wp-admin (or the URL provided after installation). Enter your username and password. You'll see the WordPress dashboard - this is your command center for managing your site.
tips: Bookmark your login page for easy access
Enable two-factor authentication for security
Familiarize yourself with the dashboard layout
The dashboard is only visible to you, not visitors

steps.title: Configure General Settings
steps.instructions: Go to 'Settings' → 'General'. Set your site title, tagline, WordPress address, timezone, date format, and language. Make sure both URL fields match (with or without www). Save changes.
tips: Site title appears in browser tabs and search results
Tagline should briefly describe what you do
Correct timezone ensures posts publish at right time
You can change these settings anytime

steps.title: Set Up Permalinks
steps.instructions: Go to 'Settings' → 'Permalinks'. Select 'Post name' structure (recommended for SEO). This makes URLs readable like yoursite.com/about instead of yoursite.com/?p=123. Click 'Save Changes'.
tips: Post name structure is best for SEO
Don't change this later - it breaks existing links
Clean URLs are easier for users to remember
Search engines prefer descriptive URLs

steps.title: Choose and Install a Theme
steps.description: Select a professional design for your website.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Appearance' → 'Themes' → 'Add New'. Browse free themes or upload a premium theme. Popular free options: Astra, GeneratePress, OceanWP. Click 'Install' then 'Activate'. Customize colors, fonts, and layout in 'Appearance' → 'Customize'.
tips: Choose a lightweight, fast-loading theme
Make sure theme is mobile-responsive
Check theme ratings and recent updates
Free themes are good for starting, premium offer more features
Astra and GeneratePress are excellent free options

steps.title: Install Essential Plugins
steps.description: Add functionality to your WordPress site.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Plugins' → 'Add New'. Search and install these essential plugins: Yoast SEO (for search optimization), Wordfence Security (protection), WPForms (contact forms), and WP Super Cache (speed). Click 'Install Now' then 'Activate' for each.
tips: Don't install too many plugins - they slow your site
Essential plugins: SEO, Security, Forms, Caching, Backup
Check plugin compatibility with your theme
Only install plugins from trusted developers
Update plugins regularly for security

steps.title: Set Up SSL Certificate
steps.description: Enable HTTPS for security and trust.
steps.instructions: Most hosts provide free SSL (Let's Encrypt). In your hosting control panel, find SSL/TLS section and install the certificate. Then install 'Really Simple SSL' plugin in WordPress to force HTTPS across your entire site. Activate and follow setup wizard.
tips: SSL is essential - browsers warn users about non-HTTPS sites
Search engines rank HTTPS sites higher
Green padlock icon builds visitor trust
Most modern hosts include free SSL

steps.title: Create Essential Pages
steps.description: Add important pages to your website.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Pages' → 'Add New'. Create these pages: Home, About, Services/Products, Blog, Contact. Write content for each page. Use the block editor (Gutenberg) to add text, images, buttons, etc. Click 'Publish' when done.
tips: Homepage should clearly explain what you offer
About page builds trust - include your story
Contact page needs a form and your email
Write naturally - avoid corporate jargon
Use high-quality images
Include call-to-action buttons

steps.title: Set Up Navigation Menus
steps.instructions: Go to 'Appearance' → 'Menus'. Create a new menu, name it 'Main Menu'. Add your pages by checking boxes and clicking 'Add to Menu'. Drag to reorder. Assign menu to 'Primary Menu' location. Save.
tips: Keep main menu simple - 5-7 items max
Most important pages go first
Use dropdown menus for subcategories
Create separate footer menu for legal pages
Test menu on mobile devices

steps.title: Configure Contact Form
steps.description: Set up a contact form so visitors can reach you.
steps.instructions: Open WPForms plugin → 'Add New'. Choose 'Simple Contact Form' template. Customize fields (Name, Email, Message). Go to 'Settings' to set notification email. Copy the shortcode, then paste it on your Contact page. Update the page.
tips: Keep forms short - ask only necessary info
Enable spam protection (reCAPTCHA)
Test form submissions to make sure you receive emails
Add form to sidebar or footer for easy access
Respond to inquiries within 24 hours

steps.title: Set Up Google Analytics
steps.description: Track your website visitors and traffic.
steps.instructions: Create a Google Analytics account. Get your tracking ID. Install 'MonsterInsights' plugin (free version) or use your theme's built-in Analytics field. Paste your tracking ID in the settings. Verify data is being collected in Google Analytics dashboard.
tips: Analytics shows who visits, where they're from, and what they do
Allow 24-48 hours for data to start showing
Check reports weekly to understand your audience
Use insights to improve your content

steps.title: Launch Your Website
steps.instructions: Test all pages and links. Check mobile responsiveness using phone or browser dev tools. Verify forms work. Check spelling and grammar. Set up regular backups. Share on social media. Consider submitting to Google Search Console for better indexing.
tips: Test site on multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)
Ask friends to review before announcing
Set up weekly automatic backups
Plan to update content regularly
Install security plugin and keep WordPress updated
Consider SEO optimization for better search rankings
